alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Elk (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 5:32PM EDT until June 16 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CAMERON AND SOUTHEASTERN ELK COUNTIES... At 531 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Benezette, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Cameron and southeastern Elk Counties, including the following locations... Weedville and Kersey. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central and north central Pennsylvania. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. This storm has produced widespread wind damage across Elk County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
